thread.title: Dallas-Fort Worth's WNBA team plans to unveil name, logo, ticket details next month
thread.title_full: Dallas-Fort Worth's WNBA team plans to unveil name, logo, ticket details next month | Dallas Morning News

author: Tommy Cummings
title: Dallas-Fort Worth's WNBA team plans to unveil name, logo, ticket details next month
text:
Circle Nov. 2 on your WNBA calendar.
That's when WNBA officials and owners of the franchise formerly known as the Tulsa Shock have scheduled a news conference to announce key developments for a team that will be based in Dallas-Fort Worth.
Star guard Skylar Diggins and WNBA Commissioner Laurel Ritchie are expected to unveil a new team name and logo and details of the team's ticket program at College Park Center on University of Texas-Arlington campus.
The team will play its 17 home games at College Park Center, 400 S. Center St., in 2016.
In July, WNBA owners unanimously approved a plan to move the team to the Dallas-Fort Worth area. The franchise is one of 12 in the league and are the first to relocate since they left Detroit for Tulsa in 2009.
At the time, team majority owner Bill Cameron called Dallas-Fort Worth "one of the most prolific sports regions in the country," adding that it has "a proven affinity for women's basketball."
As the Tulsa Shock last season, the team won eight of its first nine games before Diggins was lost for the season with an ACL injury.
The team will be the first women's pro basketball club in the area since the Dallas Diamonds in the late '70s and early '80s.
